alert.note: Alert for Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey...including the following county...Ocean. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Toms River, Barnegat, Beachwood, Seaside Heights, Mantoloking, Brookville, Beach Haven West, Dover Beaches, South Toms River, Island Heights, and Waretown. - This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 61 and 81. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
